questions.question: What is the cosmic coincidence problem in cosmology?
options: The problem of why the densities of dark energy and dark matter are nearly equal today
The problem of why the universe appears isotropic from Earth
The problem of why the cosmological constant is non-zero
The problem of why there are more matter particles than anti-matter particles
questions.correct_answer: The problem of why the densities of dark energy and dark matter are nearly equal today

questions.question: What is the baryon asymmetry problem in cosmology?
options: The problem of why there is more matter than antimatter in the universe
The problem of why galaxies have more baryonic matter than intergalactic space
The problem of why the universe is not composed entirely of hydrogen and helium
The problem of why the cosmological constant is non-zero
questions.correct_answer: The problem of why there is more matter than antimatter in the universe

questions.question: What is the name of the effect where the frequency of light changes due to the expansion of the universe?
options: Doppler effect
Zeeman effect
Compton scattering
Cosmological redshift

questions.question: What does the Tolman surface brightness test suggest about the universe's spatial curvature?
options: The universe is positively curved
The universe is negatively curved
The universe is flat
The test provides no information about the universe's curvature

questions.question: What does the term 'dark' in dark matter and dark energy signify?
options: They are evil forces
They absorb all light
They are mysterious and not well understood
They do not interact with electromagnetic radiation
questions.correct_answer: They do not interact with electromagnetic radiation

questions.question: What is the Sachs-Wolfe effect?
options: It describes the change in the frequency of cosmic microwave background photons as they climb out of potential wells
It describes the acceleration of the universe's expansion due to dark energy
It describes the scattering of light by dust particles in space
It describes the polarization of cosmic microwave background radiation
questions.correct_answer: It describes the change in the frequency of cosmic microwave background photons as they climb out of potential wells

questions.question: What does the no-hair theorem state about black holes?
options: Black holes cannot have a complex internal structure
Black holes have no hair
Black holes can be fully described by just their mass, charge, and angular momentum
Black holes lose all information about the objects that formed them
questions.correct_answer: Black holes can be fully described by just their mass, charge, and angular momentum

questions.question: What is the Hubble tension in cosmology?
options: The disagreement between different measurements of the Hubble constant
The tension caused by the expansion of the universe
The stretching of cosmic strings due to the expansion of the universe
The debate over whether the universe will eventually contract
questions.correct_answer: The disagreement between different measurements of the Hubble constant

questions.question: What is the concept of 'Cosmic Inflation' proposed by Alan Guth?
options: The financial cost of observing the universe
The expansion of the universe after the Big Bang
The change in the shape of galaxies over time
The expansion of the universe before the Big Bang
questions.correct_answer: The expansion of the universe after the Big Bang

questions.question: What does the term 'recombination' refer to in cosmology?
options: The process where protons and neutrons combined to form nuclei
The process where galaxies merged to form larger structures
The process where free electrons and nuclei combined to form neutral atoms
The process where dark matter particles combined to form larger particles
questions.correct_answer: The process where free electrons and nuclei combined to form neutral atoms
